qas.question: What was one of the quickest areas to evolve in military technology in the 20th century?
The evolution of air defence was in answer to the evolution of what?
In addition to radar and computing, what else did air defence want to exploit?
In addition to sensors and technical fire control, and weapons, what else did air defence evolution cover?

context: Throughout the 20th century <a0_0>air defence<a0_0/> was one of the fastest-evolving areas of military technology, responding to the evolution of <a1_0>aircraft<a1_0/> and exploiting various enabling technologies, particularly radar, <a2_0>guided missiles<a2_0/> and computing (initially electromechanical analog computing from the 1930s on, as with equipment described below). Air defence evolution covered the areas of sensors and technical fire control, weapons, and <a3_0>command and control<a3_0/>. At the start of the 20th century these were either very primitive or non-existent.
